comment: I’m really surprised by this scotch. It’s surprisingly good, with a peaty, burned band aide taste, with briny, iodine aftertaste. Like a real good and expensive Islay ought to be.
Budget islay solid for 20 bucks give it a try
For a cheap Islay this is fairly decent. Not very well balanced but an ok flavor, all smoke and brine.
Way to much smoke, not high quality. Not much thought in it.
A nice peaty and smoky blend.  A little harsh in the finish but overall a decent scotch for under $20
Nothing but iodine and burning for me
Strong peaty flavor and smooth with a nice fullness of flavor

at first approach I was blown away. this is my first Islay Peated Scotch. All I got was deep smoke like if I threw a wet rag into my pit smoker for 3 hours and took a whiff. first glass was all iodine, brine and that same smoke. Like sipping dripping from a fire pit. I left alone for a week came back. this time it was a sweeter, more fruit notes coming thru but still harsh smoke and peat. Then I started mixing into cocktails, the Penicillin is a good one to approach this hell fire Peaty Scotch
Decent for the price. Lots of peat, little skunky, and not very deep or complex. Good for the price.
Cheap and very drinkable. Medicinal with a flash of peat on the back
Peaty, smoky with strong burn on the after taste
Strong peaty notes, well worth the money $20.

Not a 4 star overall, but for under $20 it is the smokiest you'll find. If you like JW black but want more smoke on a budget, give this a try. If you drink a nicer scotch first you will notice the flaws, but as a starter dirnk it is very tasty.
